media:group.media:title: Polar vs Nonpolar - Amoeba Sisters #Shorts
media:group.media:description:
In this Short, The Amoeba Sisters take a look at what "polar" and "nonpolar" means in biology when talking about bonds [specifically covalent bonds but this Short does not go into covalent vs ionic bonds]. This Short also mentions that whether a molecule is polar or not is more than just the bonds it has - but also its structure and geometry. To see our Amoeba Sisters Shorts Playlist, visit https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLwL0Myd7Dk1Hby0rih8yhnwGUv9lb-2PB  To see our longer biology content videos, see our biology learning playlist here https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLwL0Myd7Dk1F0iQPGrjehze3eDpco1eVz  #shorts  #amoebasisters #amoebasistersshort
-----------------------------------------------------------
Factual Reference: 

Fowler, Samantha, et al. “2.1 the Building Blocks of Molecules - Concepts of Biology | OpenStax.” Openstax.org, 25 Apr. 2013, openstax.org/books/concepts-biology/pages/2-1-the-building-blocks-of-molecules.

Urry, Lisa A, et al. Campbell Biology. 11th ed., New York, Ny, Pearson Education, Inc, 2017.
-----------------------------------------------------------
Further Reading Suggestions:

Learn more about electronegativity and the trend on the periodic table!
https://openstax.org/books/chemistry-2e/pages/7-2-covalent-bonding

What do we mean that a molecule could have polar bonds but the molecule itself be nonpolar? Learn how a molecule's structure and geometry contribute to whether it being polar or nonpolar. 
https://openstax.org/books/chemistry-2e/pages/7-6-molecular-structure-and-polarity
